intro: Pleconax subconica subsp. grisebachii, commonly known as the gray-stemmed pleconax, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem that often exhibits a distinctive grayish hue, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slightly hairy texture. This subspecies is typically found in specific alpine or arctic habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
